page.title: 10School closure Kirkandrews
page.content: Following concerted representations from the local population, the decision to transfer pupils from Kirkandrews on Eden to Burgh by Sands Primary School has been deferred until the latter is remodelled to present day standards. At present the teaching spaces at Burgh are housed in HORSA huts which are nearing the end of their useful life. The original decision was made in 1982 as part of cost cutting exercises allied to a fall in the number of pupils attending rural schools. Kirkandrews school occupies an eminent position above the River Eden and consists of one large room, one small room,two small cloak rooms and outside toilets. Mid-day meals are transported from Burgh school kitchen.
